info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 6:32PM CDT until June 13 at 11:50AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Salado Creek At at Loop 13 affecting Bexar County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Salado Creek at at Loop 13.
* WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Major lowland flooding reaches the Loop 13 bridge floor. Secondary roads, low bridges and access roads are flooded and very dangerous to motorists.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM CDT Thursday was 24.9 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and will fall below flood stage later tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.0 feet on 11/01/1977. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at noon CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING
